intro: Paraeremostachys anisochila, commonly known as the variable spikegrass, is a perennial grass species native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
